newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt foreign reserves $19.1 bln end 1996-minister.
newsitem.headline: Egypt foreign reserves $19.1 bln end 1996-minister.

text.p: Egypt's foreign reserves were about $19.1 billion at the end of December, 1996, Economy and International Cooperation Minister Nawal el-Tatawi was quoted on Saturday as saying.
Officials have said foreign reserves rose to $18.9 billion at the end of November, equivalent to more than 16 months of imports at 1995/6 levels, from $18.5 billion at end-June.
Bankers had attributed the rise in November mainly to central bank purchases of foreign exchange which has flowed into Egypt in the form of portfolio or direct investments.
Al-Ahram newspaper quoted Tatawi on Saturday as saying that Egypt's privatisation and trade liberalisation programme has achieved tangible progress.

She said the private sector contributed about 65 percent of gross domestic product (GDP) in the financial year ending June, 1996. "The performance of the Egyptian economy has exceeded expectations," she was quoted as saying.
She said GDP was expected to grow 5.7 percent in 1996/7 compared to 4.9 percent growth in 1995/6.
